data.text:
Hi everybody! My name is Carlos Bujosa and I’m a pianist completing my Master studies in Lübeck (Germany). I also have worked as a piano teacher at different music schools and giving private lessons.

I often play with other instrumentalists and singers, making chamber music or accompanying them to concerts and festivals.

I have taken courses in cultural management and festival organization.

Biography

Born in 2000 in Tarragona, the musical training of Carlos Bujosa Salazar has taken him to the Conservatori de Vila-seca under the guidance of Núria Ruera and Cecilio Tieles, and to the Centre Superior de la Fundació Conservatori Liceu, where he had a grant from the Fundació de Música Ferrer-Salat to study with support from pianist Alba Ventura and the master Stanislav Pochekin.

At 9 years old, he did his first concert tour around the districts of Tarragona, and today he has now played in many venues in our region such as the Atlántida in Vic, the Auditori Enric Granados in Lleida and the Auditori AXA in Barcelona, as well as others. At 15 years old, he made his orchestra debut in the Auditori Josep Carreras in Vila-seca with the performance of Concerto for Piano and Orchestra No. 23 in A major, K. 488 by W. A. Mozart. Carlos recently made his debut in the Gran Teatre del Liceu as pianist of the production La nit de Sant Joan, performing the work Soirées de Barcelone, a creation for ballet by Catalan composer Robert Gerhard.

By taking part in festivals around Spain, France, Italy, Switzerland, Germany, Liechtenstein, Poland, Norway and Israel he has been given advice and master classes from leading figures such as Dmitri Bashkirov, Paul Badura-Skoda, Boris Berman, Lilya Zilberstein, Claudio Martínez-Mehner, Edith Fischer, Josep Colom, Vladimir Viardo, Cyprien Katsaris, Dmitri Alexeev, Luiz de Moura, Akiko Ebi and Péter Nagy, in addition to others.

He has been awarded first and second prizes, as well as a special mention in numerous competitions in our country at an international level, with these including the Concurs per a Joves Intèrprets de Piano de Catalunya, Certamen Intercentros Melómano, Premios BBVA de Música en Talento Individual, Concurso Internacional de Piano de Sigüenza, Premi de Música Ciutat de Mataró, Concurso Instrumental San Anastasis and Premis per a Joves Pianistes de Torredembarra.

Carlos is currently studying a master’s degree at Musikhochschule Lübeck in the city of Lübeck in Germany under the mastery of Konstanze Eickhorst.
